item.title: 【Helpdesk】Help Compile This "Edition" of x264 to Encode PAFF-interlaced Videos
item.description:
Hello, everyone!

I'm terribly sorry if there are some violations of the rules for posting in this thread. I DID try to find the full set somewhere, but couldn't find it.

Anyways, it's with a small ask that am writing to fellow "Sharemaniacs" haha...I need HELP compiling this C code (https://github.com/kierank/x264-paff) from github that's basically a specific flavor of the well-known and beloved x264, but which also has support for PAFF encoding, in addition to MBAFF. Now, I am aware there are encoders available that do support PAFF, amongst which are NVEnc, and Intel's QSV H.264 encoder. HOWEVER, outputs created by QSV's encoder, which I have had experience with, tend to produce (well, at least to my palate) poor-quality videos, and very importantly, that encoder doesn't support PAFF encoding with 4:2:2 chroma subsampling. MBAFF does 4:2:2 chroma, but it always plays back horribly on my laptop, for some reason. Meanwhile, PAFF encodes have no issues.

I have spent hours trying to compile that code by myself, but had no success. PLEASE, if there are any technologically inclined kind nerds among us who can help, I would be infinitely grateful.

Thanks, in advance, and have a great day, everybody!!!
item.author: auser-hNx99
